Comments_List: Great course. Interactive class and Prof Rajit is great. Give a good feel for how testing works for chips
Great class; carefully examined & reviewed several techniques and algorithms used in testing devices.
I learned about advanced techniques used to test chips.
One great thing was the student presentations and classroom interaction. A good extension of the VLSI course

As a follow-up course to Silicon Compilation, this is a bit difficult to state. Getting the chips back before the class ended would have been nice, but this was outside of Professor Manohar's control.
Yes, its a great course, and an amazing follow up to the VLSI course, which talks about different faults and algorithms to detect these.
Yes if you've taken Silicon Compilation. It's a really laid back course.
If you have taken Silicon Compilation, then why not? It was a nice break on some of my Fridays.
